results.title: Manon des Sources
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Second and concluding part of the story based on the novel by Marcel Pagnol that began with “Jean de Florette”. This part, taking place ten years later, deals with the revenge inflicted by Jean’s daughter on those responsible for his death. An absorbing tale that makes its leisurely way to an unexpected climax. Stars Daniel Auteuil, Yves Montand and Emmanuelle Beart.

results.title: Go West
results.creator_credit: Edward Buzzell, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers go to America’s wild west where the man who gets the deed to Dead Man’s Gulch gets rich. Groucho, Chico and Harpo go west in search of the deed. Filled with typical Marx Brothers’ lunacy, “Go West” climaxes with the wildest train chase on film. Cast also includes John Carroll, Diana lewis, Walter Woolf King, Robert Barrat.

results.title: The Little Mermaid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ron Clements, John Musker, Howard Ashman and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Mermaids are supposed to stay under the sea, but there was never a mermaid quite like Ariel. The headstrong teenager longs to be part of the magical world on land, much to the dismay of her father, King Triton. When she falls in love with a human Prince, Ariel looks to Ursula, a sea witch. With the help of her friends, Ariel must win her prince’s love in a thrilling race against time. This production of “The Little Mermaid” based on the fairytale by Hans Christian Andersen is full of dazzling animation.

results.title: Jean de Florette
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Lavish film version of Marcel Pagnol’s tale of a simple man who leaves the city to live on an inherited piece of land but is ruined when he fails to find water to irrigate his property because the location of an underground spring is kept secret from him by two scheming villagers who wish to take over the farm. The conclusion to this story comes in the sequel, “Manon des Sources”. “Jean de Florette” stars Yves Montand and Gerard Depardieu.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions

results.title: From here to eternity
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Buddy Adler and Columbia
results.brief_description: A searing indictment of military life, where one walks the line or pays the price. In a peacetime army camp in Hawaii, the commander’s wife, Deborah Kerr, and career soldier, Burt Lancaster, risk everything in a love affair that could destroy them. Persecuted by his peers, hard-headed Prewitt (Montgomery Clift) wants to settle down with prostitute Donna Reed, but she yearns for a better life. Prewitt’s only friend, Frank Sinatra, stands up to sadistic guard, Ernest Borgnine, and pays the ultimate price. The film culminates in an explosive climax on December 7, 1941, with the attack on Pearl Harbour. “From Here to Eternity” is a riveting drama, considered one of Hollywood’s greatest achievements. Based on the novel by James Jones.

results.title: The Mouse that roared
results.creator_credit: Jack Arnold, Carl Foreman and Columbia
results.brief_description: The near-bankrupt Duchy of Grand Fenwick plans to declare war on the USA, be defeated and thus be eligible for Marshall Aid to rebuild its economy. One of those films in which Peter Sellers engagingly plays three parts, effectively carrying the entire film. Based on the novel by Leonard Wibberley.

results.title: The Philadelphia story
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A wealthy society girl, who is about to marry for the second time, finds she still loves her first husband. Cukor’s direction is so discreet you can hardly sense it. Starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart. Based on a play by Philip Barry.

results.title: Klute
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Her name is Bree Daniels. She’s a tough, high-priced call girl picking her way through the tangled lives that touch hers in the dark maze of New York. Bree once crossed paths with a vicious psychotic killer, who is now stalking her. The only person that can save her is Detective John Klute. Stars Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland. Excellent adult thriller with attention to detail and emphasis on character.

results.title: The Moon in the Gutter = la Lune Dans le Caniveau
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Lise Fayolle, TF1 Films productions and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu plays a dock-worker seeking the rapist responsible for his sister’s death. He becomes involved with a wealthy woman (Nastassia Kinski) who assists him in his search. “The moon in the gutter” is notable for its visual beauty and its stunning camera work and editing. By the director of “Diva” and “Betty Blue” and based on a book by David Goodis.

results.title: Ryan's daughter
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Mitchum is the rural school master Charles Shaughnessy who, returning home to Ireland in 1916, just after the Easter Rising against the British, falls in love with and marries one of his old pupils, Rosy Ryan. Their happiness is upset by the arrival of a Major who comes to take command of the British Army and is immediately drawn towards Rosy. Political events finally overtake all affairs of the heart, and it is obvious that life in the village of Kirrary will never be the same again. Scripted by Robert Bolt the film also stars Sarah Miles, John Mills, Trevor Howard and Leo McKern.
